TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void LogCallback(LogLevel level, string message, bool containsPii);
.class public auto ansi sealed LogCallback extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub LogCallback(level As LogLevel, message As String, containsPii As Boolean)
type LogCallback = delegate of LogLevel * string * bool -> unit

Docs.param: Log level of the log message to process

Indicates if the log message contains Organizational Identifiable Information (OII) or Personally Identifiable Information (PII) nor not. If is set to false then this value is always false. Otherwise it will be true when the message contains PII.
Docs.summary: Callback delegate that allows application developers to consume logs, and handle them in a custom manner. This callback is set on the member of the static class. If is set to true, this method will receive the messages twice: once with the containsPii parameter equals false and the message without PII, and a second time with the containsPii parameter equals to true and the message might contain PII. In some cases (when the message does not contain PII), the message will be the same. For details see https://aka.ms/msal-net-logging
